inputs.selection_motivation: China’s export growth signals rising global demand and strengthens U.S. economic activity, which in turn lifts intermediate‑term Treasury yields.
inputs.candidate_motivation: China Exports is a barometer of global demand and trade flows, so it is tightly linked to currency dynamics (USD/CNY, DXY), monetary policy (Fed, ECB), commodity prices (oil, copper, wheat, gold), and domestic credit conditions (China Credit Impulse). It also correlates with US macro data that influence the dollar and risk appetite, such as inflation, services PMI, and Treasury yields.
